results.name: a(n) = nextprime( p(n)/2 if p(n)=2 (mod 3), 2p(n) else ) = A007918( A138750( A000040( n ))).
comment: Composing the map A138750 with A007918 to the left and restricting it to the primes makes it a mapping from primes into primes which is a natural generalization of the Collatz problem to primes. (Looking at parity would not be interesting for primes, so using "mod 3" is the simplest nontrivial generalization.)
The only even prime p=2 is the only fixed point of this map and all odd primes seem to end up in the loop 7 -> 17 -> 11 -> 7, after a number of steps given in A138752.
The sequence A124123 lists the primes which do not occur in the present sequence.
link: Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
program: (PARI) A138751(n) = { n=prime(n); nextprime( if( n%3==2, ceil(n/2), 2*n ))}
